tasks.title: Setup project infrastructure
tasks.description: Initialize Node.js project with TypeScript and necessary dependencies
tasks.details: Create package.json, configure TypeScript, install axios for HTTP requests, node-cron for scheduling
tasks.testStrategy: Verify all dependencies installed and TypeScript compiles without errors

tasks.title: Create HTTP client for data fetching
tasks.description: Implement robust HTTP client to fetch JSON from bir.by/ai/json_ai.php
tasks.details: Use axios with retry logic, timeout handling, and response validation. Add exponential backoff for retries
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests for HTTP client with mocked responses, test retry logic and error scenarios

tasks.title: Design property data model
tasks.description: Create TypeScript interfaces for property data structure
tasks.details: Define interfaces for Apartment, type, Quarter, Status, Square, Price_metr, Price_full fields
tasks.testStrategy: Type checking with TypeScript compiler, validate against sample JSON data

tasks.title: Implement JSON parser and validator
tasks.description: Parse and validate incoming JSON data structure
tasks.details: Use zod or joi for schema validation, handle missing fields gracefully, normalize data formats
tasks.testStrategy: Test with valid and invalid JSON samples, edge cases with missing fields

tasks.title: Setup database infrastructure
tasks.description: Create database schema for property storage
tasks.details: PostgreSQL or MongoDB schema with properties table, sync_history table, and indexes for performance
tasks.testStrategy: Database migration tests, verify schema creation and indexes

tasks.title: Implement data synchronization logic
tasks.description: Create upsert logic for database updates
tasks.details: Track changes, implement diff detection, handle conflicts, maintain sync timestamps
tasks.testStrategy: Integration tests with test database, verify upsert behavior

tasks.title: Create sync scheduler

tasks.testStrategy: Test scheduler triggers, verify no concurrent execution

tasks.title: Implement logging system
tasks.description: Add comprehensive logging for sync operations
tasks.details: Use winston or pino, log levels, file rotation, structured logging for monitoring
tasks.testStrategy: Verify log outputs, test rotation, check log levels

tasks.title: Create monitoring dashboard
tasks.description: Build status dashboard for sync monitoring
tasks.details: REST API endpoints for status, web UI with React or Vue, display sync history and errors
tasks.testStrategy: API endpoint tests, UI component tests, integration test

tasks.title: Add alerting system
tasks.details: Email or Slack notifications, configurable thresholds, alert on consecutive failures
tasks.testStrategy: Test alert triggering, verify notification delivery

tasks.title: Update South America data file with 2025 information
tasks.description: Update the quarters/9-Yuzhnaya-Amerika.md file with current 2025 data on South American countries, including population, economic indicators, political changes, and regional issues.
tasks.details:
This task involves updating the South America data file with comprehensive 2025 information:

1. Research and gather current data for all South American countries:
   - Population statistics from reliable sources (UN, World Bank)
   - Economic indicators (GDP, inflation rates, trade balances)
   - Political changes (recent elections, government shifts)
   - Environmental issues in the Amazon region (deforestation rates, conservation efforts)
   - Regional conflicts and security situations
   - Migration patterns and refugee statistics
   - Integration initiatives (Mercosur, UNASUR) updates

2. Technical implementation:
   - Clone the repository and create a feature branch
   - Update the quarters/9-Yuzhnaya-Amerika.md file using Markdown formatting
   - Ensure proper structure with headings, tables, and lists
   - Include data sources as references at the end of the document
   - Maintain consistent formatting with other regional files
   - Add appropriate metadata tags if used in the system

3. Data validation:
   - Cross-check information from multiple sources
   - Ensure numerical data is accurate and properly formatted
   - Verify political information reflects current governments
   - Validate environmental data with recent scientific reports

4. Integration considerations:
   - Ensure the updated file follows the established data schema
   - Check for any dependencies on this data in other system components
   - Update any timestamp or version information in the file metadata
   - Ensure the file is properly encoded (UTF-8) to support multilingual content

The update should be comprehensive while maintaining the existing file structure and integration with the synchronization system.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Content verification:
   - Review all updated data points against source materials
   - Verify population figures match latest official estimates
   - Confirm economic data matches World Bank/IMF reports
   - Validate political information against official government sources
   - Check environmental data against recent scientific publications
   - Ensure migration data matches UNHCR or IOM statistics

2. Technical validation:
   - Validate Markdown syntax using a linter
   - Check for broken links or references
   - Verify UTF-8 encoding to ensure proper display of special characters
   - Test file rendering in the application's display environment
   - Ensure file size is reasonable and optimized

3. Integration testing:
   - Verify the updated file can be properly synchronized using the system's sync logic
   - Test that the file appears correctly in the monitoring dashboard
   - Confirm the file passes any validation checks in the system
   - Verify the file can be properly accessed through any relevant APIs

4. User acceptance testing:
   - Have subject matter experts review the content for accuracy
   - Verify the information displays correctly in the user interface
   - Check that any data visualizations using this information render properly

Document all test results and any issues found during the testing process.
